greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of partitions of n in which any two parts differ by at most k.
comment: T(n,k) = A000041(n) for n >= 0 and k >= n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
formula: G.f. of column k: 1 + Sum_{j>0} x^j / Product_{i=0..k} (1-x^(i+j)).
maple: b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember;
else b(n, i-1, k-1) +b(n-i, i, k)
mathematica: b[n_, i_, k_] := b[n, i, k] = If[n < 0 || k < 0, 0, If[n == 0, 1, If[i < 1, 0, b[n, i-1, k-1] + b[n-i, i, k]]]]; t[n_, k_] := If[n == 0, 1, 0] + Sum[b[n-i, i, k], {i, 1, n}]; Table[Table[t[n, k], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 20}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 09 2013, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 30 2011
